text: Alexander Graham Bell received a US patent for an "Improvement in Telegraphy" (No.174,465) which established the principle of bidirectional signals that made the telephone possible.
The first successful Transatlantic telephone call was placed between New York City and London. Transatlantic service began the following year at $75 a minute.
The Supreme Court found that 2 Live Crew's parody of Roy Orbison's "Oh Pretty Woman" was fair use, and not a violation of copyright, thus ensuring the future of The Onion.
